reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the stay there. We stayed there over a weekend in a four-poster room. We liked it a lot. Great room and bathroom, staff friendly, unintrusive and unlike some other elegant country hotels quite down to earth.
reviews.title: Want to go back... and so does my dog!

reviews.text: We also ha my dog with us (one of the reasons we picked the hotel), and he loed it there soooo much - he would not go back into the car when we were about to leave. He thought it was his castle ;o)
reviews.title: murder mystery

reviews.text: celebrated sons 18th, stayed in two suites one of which had a secret door into the library ! Rooms were inkeeping with the style of the house. both suites were large and well equipped the food we had was good. the english breakfast excellent. Mostly what impressed us was the service which was extremely friendly and helpful. The murder mystery was a great success and the characters involved everyone. The whole visit was thoroughly enjoyable.
reviews.title: Not as good as we hoped

likes.liked: — the drive up to the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an off the cuff holiday break. We checked out doggy friendly hotels and saw this one. Couldn't believe our luck when it offered 4 nights for the prcice of 3 and doggy came free. You could walk forever on the estate (yes estate) If I had to make a moan it would only be that we were in a small attic like room at the top of the building, quite a way to go if you forgot anything. Would deffinately reccommend and would certainly go again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, beautiful grounds, helpful staff, dogs made very welcome what more could you want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Kitley House Hotel for a week and had a brilliant time. The hotel is beautiful, real old world charm with 600 acres of grounds to explore. We wanted a real getaway from it all break and that’s just what we got. We spent our time wandering around the grounds which are beautiful and generally eating well. The breakfast’s at Kitley are amazing, loads of choice and I can see why they have received awards for them, in fact all the food was wonderful – highly recommended. We stayed in a suite on the first floor which was nice and large and had a wonderful view of the river Yealm which runs past the hotel. The rooms are well decorated and kept really clean by the staff. We will certainly be returning to Kitley.
reviews.title: Wonderful Time at Beautiful Kitley House Hotel

reviews.text: I would expect a missed response even from our own party attending a funeral ceremony at Kitley house. Our room was large, clean and delightfully aged, rough around the edges but character. If the wedding party had gone on it would have sounded straight through our ground floor bathroom door but we were also up late and it didn't matter although we felt excluded from the bar area because of the wedding. No help with lugguage, no lift. Food was first class and lots of packages which offer good value booking on web site. It was the monsoon season so olny had view of the huge lake, no doubt in season its a small river. The staff were friendly and if you avoid weddings and accept corporate events as inevitable then you'll be fine here.
reviews.title: Great If You Avoid Weddings

likes.liked: — large comfortable room and good food

reviews.text: I have stayed in Kitley House Hotel for almost two and a half months now on business.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

likes.liked: — Comfortable rooms, great restaurant, free internet access

reviews.text: Kitley house is a very nice environment to stay in. On a secluded country estate it boasts beautiful gardens and pieceful surroundings. During my whole stay I've not been disturbed.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Kitley House

reviews.text: Many times you book a hotel and when you arrive you are disappointed. For me, this hotel is exactly what I'm looking for, it has traditional style, great location, seclusion, friendly atmosphere and great food.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room wasn't one of the best, but for the price I paid it was fine. On a cold day with an open fire in the lounge and Dining room it had lots of character and a warmth to enjoy. The restaurant is fine dining without the price and the Chef makes a fine effort to give you Michelin style food.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a wedding location it would be fabulous, but for me it's a great escape from the normal modern faceless hotels normally available.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Guys well done I love it.
reviews.title: Total relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Kitley House from 30 Sept to 3 October. We took our 2 dogs with us and the hotel grounds are fantastic for dog walks (non dog lovers should know that dogs are made very welcome here!). We were in the Sarah Martin Suite which was very spacious and comfortable with beautiful view of the surrounding grounds. The staff are very helpful and the food is good - make sure you have at least one cream tea!
reviews.title: Wonderful Country House Hotel
